profile_positions.description:
http://www.blindspeed.com.au

Ben Felten’s dream is to become the world’s fastest blind man.
On a salt lake in outback South Australia the Blind Speed team will challenge the world record of 265.33km/h for the fastest speed for a motorcycle ridden blindfolded at Speed Week 2017.
With the support of his brother Leo, radio communications expert Paul Simpson and his navigator Kevin Magee former MotoGP winner, Ben Felten will be the first blind person in the world to compete at a motorsport event.
profile_positions.title: Support for cousin Ben Felten

volunteer_experiences.role: World Clean Up Day - Voluntary - External
volunteer_experiences.description:
21 September 2019 City: De Goorn.

Actions are organized throughout the country on World Clean up Day. Together with companies, schools, sports clubs, friends and family, we are rolling up our sleeves that day to give the Netherlands a major clean-up.
